Case reference: 2017023773.CaseDesc: On April 18, 2017 the body of an unidentified man was recovered from the Ottawa River near Wendover, Ontario. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts this man was either of European ancestry, or Middle Eastern/North African ancestry, or mixed European and Middle Eastern/North ancestry.

Case reference: 2021038782.CaseDesc: On June 17, 2017, at approximately 7:50 p.m., John Shankland was last seen near the Brink of the American Falls in Niagara Falls, New York. During the time of his disappearance, John was despondent.

Shirt: Yellow, TEE SHIRT, T-shirt; “volunteer for MS, New York Chapter 2010”
Scar: Right Forearm, Three-inch scar from cancer surgery

Case reference: 2011000299.CaseDesc: On September 2, 2010, the skeletal remains of a Caucasian male were found in the forest near Chemin Lac Clair in West Nipissing, Ontario. He is believed to have been there from two weeks to six months.

Hair: Brown, Short, Shorter than collar length
Teeth: Some dental work and some untreated dental disease
Other: Signs of arthritis in his feet. Bandages on them suggesting that he may have experienced pain

Case reference: 2014005265.CaseDesc: On June 13, 2009, at approximately 4:00 p.m., Devon Moldowan was seen for the last time as he left his apartment in Jasper, Alberta. It is believed that Devon left on foot, and may have been despondent during the time of his disappearance.

Pants: Black, Patches with yellow and orange stitching; baggy
Tattoo: Chest, The words "I'll keep you here for all my"

Case reference: 2013000068.CaseDesc: On October 27, 1994, Yvon Ringuet was reported missing from his home in the Rosemont-La Petite-Patrie district in Montreal, Quebec. Yvon would call or visit his mother everyday. All his personal belongings were found in his home and no one has seen or heard from him since.

Tattoo: Cross, right or left upper arm

Case reference: 2008002499.CaseDesc: On August 21, 1983, three men were doing some repairs to a dock at the cottage when they heard a male voice shouting "Help" three times approximately 5 seconds apart. All three witnesses observed a boat turning in circles. Two of the men ran to their boat and went to the out-of-control boat. They found the boat unattended. They were unable to locate the victim, Robert Kennedy. The boat ran ashore and Mr. Kennedy has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2013000109.CaseDesc: On October 25, 1996, Huguette Douville was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. She walks with an irregular gait, specifically a hunchback posture and always carries grocery bags. Huguette regularly hitchhikes.

Case reference: 2014002329.CaseDesc: Blair Henry Yensen left his residence in the town of Capreol on January 7th, 1992. He was last seen walking on Ski Hill Road. He has a noticeable limp, walks with a cane and has a shoe insert in his left shoe. He smokes very heavily. He suffers from severe depression, seems to be quite religious, and speaks in a religious manner.

Jacket: Fishing Jacket, blue with yellow and gold lettering on the front and back.

Case reference: 2012020159.CaseDesc: In July 2004, the remains of an unidentified man were found on the shore of the Fraser River in Richmond, British Columbia. The man had good dental work and had a gold tooth in his left lower jaw. It is estimated that he may have died in 2003 or early 2004.

Case reference: 2008004299.CaseDesc: Ghazaros Allahverdioglu was boating with family on Fairy Lake in the town of Huntsville, Ontario.  He apparently fell off the boat by One Tree Island in Fairy Lake.

Case reference: 2014003930.CaseDesc: On May 15, 1979, Murray Johnson was last seen boarding a train at 07:45 a.m. in Belleville, Ontario. He was presumed to be travelling West. Murray also had a noticeable curvature of his back. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Scar: Right Calf, War wound, skin is bunched up

Case reference: 2014004602.CaseDesc: Denis Gelinas left his home in Notre-Dame-Du-Mont-Carmel on the morning of December 31, 1993 and was never seen again.

Tattoo: Right Arm, Snake and a dagger

Case reference: 2017074234.CaseDesc: On February 27, 2016 an unidentified male believed to be between the ages of 40 to 75 years old was discovered in Jayfield Park in Brampton, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005576.CaseDesc: Daniel Dumigan's family lost contact with him in July of 1975. They received information that he was planning to leave for Vancouver, BC.

Case reference: 2005003899.CaseDesc: On September 5, 2001, a Caucasian male was found on a bench in an outhouse on a cross country ski trail in the Laurentian Hills, Deep River. He was well-tanned and had recently got a sunburn on his face. He was circumcised and his appendix was present. He is estimated to have been dead for two to three days. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts this unidentified male is of European ancestry.

Glasses: Copper, Koh Sakai, frame model KS9365, reflective lens
Jeans: Blue, Pepe, size 30, button fly front
Jewelry: Blue, Levi's, Blue faced, built in compass watch
Shoes: Black, Replay, size small running shoes

Case reference: 2020011116.CaseDesc: Glen Peddle had been hitchhiking through the United States between 1982 and 1985. In April 1985, Glen called his mother from New York to tell her that he was planning on returning home to Newfoundland in the spring, but never returned home.

Case reference: 2006013399.CaseDesc: Dustin Rhodes has been missing from the area of Timmins, Ontario since July 6, 1991.  He was last seen around 11:00 a.m. on that day near his cottage on Gibson Lake.  His truck was found at that location but Mr. Rhodes has not been seen since.

Pants: Cotton, Grey, Blue, Grey or blue work pants

Case reference: 2016068414.CaseDesc: On August 30, 1965, this unidentified male was found on the shore of Lake Ontario just east of the harbour pier in Oshawa. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 160 lbs, however, this may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present and he was not circumcised.

Teeth: Decayed teeth; gold inlay and prosthesis in his upper dentition; lower dentition had an amalgam filling
Shoes: Leather, Veritough, one left shoe; size 7
Scar: Right Upper Arm, circular puckered scar 1" in diameter on the anterior right underarm
Tattoo: Right Forearm, blue tattoo of a woman's face

Case reference: 2005001599.CaseDesc: Shawn Jones and Leslie Jones were seen on October 24, 1993. The two boys were hitchhiking from Cape Croker to Wiarton. They were dropped off in downtown Wiarton. Between October 26-28, 1993 Leslie Jones was seen with another male fitting the description of Shawn Jones. They were seen together at the Tim Hortons coffee shop in Owen Sound, Ontario. Shawn Jones was last seen on Berford Street in front of Pacific Hotel. Leslie Jones was last seen in front of the Tim Horton's restaurant on 9th East Street.

Case reference: 2021037317.CaseDesc: On 18 August, 2021, Kari Campbell was seen for the last time in the Durham Bridge region of York County, New Brunswick. Kari has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014002866.CaseDesc: On August 29, 1989, at approximately 2:40 p.m., Jason Boulton slipped and fell into the water near 12 Mile Creek at the north east corner of the Generating Station in Port Dalhousie Harbour, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006020299.CaseDesc: Mary Ann Copeman was last seen on September 5, 1993 when she left to go on a recreational walk. Ms. Copeman was known to have mental health issues and may have been in a confused state. She was walking in the vicinity of Fifth Street in Balmertown, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014030665.CaseDesc: On January 19, 1978, the partial remains of a female believed to be aged between 55-70 years of age, were found in the waters of the Salish Sea, southwest of Victoria, British Columbia. She had moderate arthritis and significant healed injuries to her left ankle and foot. It is believed she was deceased several months or even years before her remains were recovered

Case reference: 2014005574.CaseDesc: Judy Chescue was reported missing to the Edmonton Police Service in October 1988.  Judy was last seen near her home in Edmonton in July 1988.

Case reference: 2020021899.CaseDesc: Nowell HALFE was last seen by family in Edmonton, Alberta in 2013. The last documented occurrence for HALFE puts him in Edmonton, Alberta in January of 2014.

Case reference: 1984142670.CaseDesc: On January 20, 1983, at approximately 11:00 a.m., Tania Murrell was seen for the last time as she left school to return home.

Case reference: 2014002305.CaseDesc: On January 24, 1983, Dennis Howe was seen for the last time at his place of work at 333 Spadina Avenue in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004156.CaseDesc: On July 17,1975, Helen Jordan was last seen on a bench outside of 84 South Cumberland Street in Thunder Bay, Ontario. Prior to the time of her disappearance, Helen was known to frequent that area.

Case reference: 2014001545.CaseDesc: On the morning of the 6th of August 1979, Timothy Papik and his daughter Diane left Rankin Inlet, NU. heading towards Whale Cove, NU. in a canoe. They never reached their destination and they have not been seen since.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, Knife with snake, flower

Case reference: 2014005633.CaseDesc: On July 7, 2011, Dillon Mcmaster had been swimming in the Bow River in Alberta with a group of friends. Dillon was caught in a current, pulled under and was not seen again. Multiple efforts to locate Dillon were negative and he is presumed to have drowned.

Case reference: 2016069642.CaseDesc: On April 21, 1995, the remains of a woman were discovered near Carbon, Alberta. The post-mortem interval is estimated to be between 10 and 15 years. The individual had dental restorations including stainless steel crowns.

Case reference: 2014003620.CaseDesc: On April 21, 1980, Arthur Keefe was travelling with a friend on snowmobile when the pair went through the ice and into the water. His friend managed to climb out, but Mr. Keefe went under and it is not known whether he resurfaced.

Case reference: 2006010299.CaseDesc: On November 11, 1970, at approximately 4:00 p.m., Edward Bucharest and his son, Barry Bucharest, were last seen by their family members in Kenora, Ontario. The pair had left from their cottage located on Kimberly Road, north shore of the Big Stone Bay in the municipality of Lake of the Woods, in a 14-foot fiberglass boat. The capsized boat, two life jackets, and other belongings were subsequently located.

Case reference: 2005001099.CaseDesc: On April 22, 2004, an unidentified woman was discovered in a red 2004 Toyota Corolla under the Highway 400 Bridge on Highway 401 in Toronto, Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts this female to be from the Americas, South Asia, or Mixed Americas.

Case reference: 2013000033.CaseDesc: Bernard Deromer was last seen at the metro station Berri UQAM on June 5, 1982. He is blind and walks with a white cane. He may have been approached by a religious sect.

Teeth: Other, upper front tooth obliquely broken
Other: blind and walks with a white cane
Scar: Right Ear, near the right ear

Case reference: 2014001366.CaseDesc: On April 19, 1995, Paul-Henri Hardy was seen for the last time in the St-Romuald sector of Lévis, Quebec. Paul-Henry was 28 years old at the time of his disappearance.

Case reference: 2019052051.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2019, at approximately 4:00 am, Brandon Pollock was seen for the last time at his family residence in Hamilton, Ontario. That same morning, three men on a boat observed a man swimming in the area of the Lift Bridge in Lake Ontario. The men approached the swimmer, who was later identified as Brandon Pollock, to confirm his wellbeing. Brandon had told them that he was okay and advised them to pass by.

Mark: Right Side Of Neck, A brown birthmark on the right side of the neck, below the ear

Case reference: 2014004353.CaseDesc: On June 23, 2002 RCMP received a call reporting a missing person in the Village of Makinak. Reported missing was George Turnbull, 82 years old. George was last seen on June 22, 2002 at approximately 8:00 pm by a home care worker and was last spoken to on the phone by his son at approximately 10:00 pm that same day. The home care worker arrived at approximately 9:00 am on June 23, 2002 and noticed at that time George was not in his residence. At approximately 10:00 am the family began to search in and around the area of George's residence and farm yard. He suffers from mild dementia and has wandered off before. Volunteers continued to search for him until June 26, 2002 at which point the search was called off. George Turnbull was not seen again.

Case reference: 2014005826.CaseDesc: On June 4, 2012, the Banff RCMP were contacted by a tour company to report that Duc Dao and his son, Nguyen Dao of Vietnam did not arrive to board their bus at the scheduled time.  The two men had been staying at the Banff International Hotel and there were no personal items left in their room. The two men were due to fly back to Vietnam two days later. However, they did not board their scheduled flight and it is unknown if they returned to Vietnam.

Case reference: 2017060723.CaseDesc: On October 9, 2017, Amber Barlow was last seen in the area of 107 Street and 152 Avenue, Edmonton. Early the following morning, Amber made a post on social media, which she constantly used to communicate with family and friends. Her social media account had no further activity after this time. It is unknown when she left her residence, what she was last wearing or how she may have left. Amber did not have access to a vehicle and would typically use public transit to get around. She lived a high risk lifestyle and seemed despondent on the night she was last seen.

Case reference: 2021011416.CaseDesc: On March 25, 2021, Solange Bergeron was seen for the last time as she was drifting uncontrollably in the St. Lawrence River, near the Laviolette Park, in Trois-Rivières, Quebec. At the time of her disappearance, Solange was despondent.

Hair: Blonde, Long, Straight, Long and straight

Case reference: 2009004699.CaseDesc: On September 14, 1994, Kenneth Blais, 27 years of age, had an argument with his mother. He left his residence on Levesque Street, Sturgeon Falls, Ontario, saying he was going to meet up with his father. The family assumed that Kenneth went to the Ottawa region. Kenneth never met up with his father and is still missing.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, Cross done by hand

Case reference: 2010000499.CaseDesc: David Kruger was running a business with another individual, and was experiencing financial difficulties. On April 26, 1979, Mr. Kruger was last seen by his business partner, who reported him missing on May 2, 1979. He has not been seen or heard from since. Mr. Kruger's mother had died approximately 3 weeks prior, so it is possible he may have been depressed. He was last seen at his residence in Guelph, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005192.CaseDesc: In the late afternoon of May 12, 1980, Adjutor Lapointe was seen for the last time leaving his residence in his vehicle in Chicoutimi, Quebec. During this time, he was accompanied by an acquaintance.

Case reference: 2014005144.CaseDesc: On August 26, 2008, Esther De Kiewit was reported missing after her mail was not being picked up from the Post Office in Boston Bar, British Columbia. She led a transient lifestyle and was living in an abandoned travel trailer in a forested area outside of Boston Bar. Esther moved throughout the back country frequently and is believed to have last been at her trailer in April of 2008. Esther suffered from mental health issues and seizures.  She was known to dress entirely in black.

Case reference: 2014006290.CaseDesc: Roxanne Marie Isadore was reported missing by a family member on September 24, 2013.  She had been out of family contact since she moved to Edmonton from Valleyview in 2006. Her last confirmed whereabouts were in Edmonton, in June of 2008.  She was known to live in the area of, and to frequent, 118 Ave in the Beverly neighbourhood of Edmonton, AB.

Case reference: 2018070577.CaseDesc: On January 15, 2018, at approximately 6:00pm, Albert Ramponi was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2022048901.CaseDesc: On May 11, 2021, at approximately 7:33 a.m., Madison Roy-Boudreau was seen for the last time when she was picked up in a vehicle driven by a man at the corner of Assaff and Grange Streets in Bathurst, New Brunswick. Madison has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014004607.CaseDesc: George Robichaud was last seen by his roommate on March 15, 2015, at their home in Moncton, New Brunswick. George was suffering from mental health issues at the time of his disappearance.

Case reference: 2014004267.CaseDesc: On December 16, 2002, Jason MacMillan was reported missing. His brother last saw Jason on December 10, 2002 at 12:30 am when they were together on Jasper Avenue and 102 Street in Edmonton, Alberta.

Scar: Neck, scar on his neck in the throat area

Case reference: 2014003215.CaseDesc: On June 24, 1972, a group of seven people, including Hank Ethier, were fishing on the Burntwood River. Late in the day the group and their two boats went to shore for supper. One group, which included Hank, left the shore. They were however unable to get their boat started and as a result they began to drift backwards towards the rapids. This group called for help and the other boat went to their aid. Hank jumped from his boat and swam to the second one. Once they reached the disabled boat everyone was told to get in. Both boats encountered the rapids. It is assumed Hank drowned as a result of the mishap.

Case reference: 2016055037.CaseDesc: Human remains were found on May 10, 2006 in a field near Mossleigh, AB. They are believed to be those of a female, over the age of 40, possibly of Caucasian or Aboriginal descent, who was between 5’2” and 5’6”. The individual was missing teeth and likely wore an upper denture. The individual may have complained of joint pain due to arthritis. The remains appear to have been there from 1 to 5 years

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Cheek, Healed fracture of right cheek bone
Mark: Right Side Of Head, Large button osteoma on right side of forehead

Case reference: 2007002799.CaseDesc: Amanda Rudge was last seen by her mother at her residence on Enfield Place, Mississauga in August of 1991. At the time she went missing, Amanda was known to frequent the Bloor and Landsdowne area of Toronto. Amanda may have connections to the United States.

Hair: Auburn, Other, Natural Auburn dyed Blonde
Teeth: Broken Front Tooth which had been fixed
Pierce: Ears, Several piercings in both ears
Tattoo: Left Foot, APBT letters on her left toes

Case reference: 2014002145.CaseDesc: On September 13, 1975, Mr. Garson with his father, brother and a friend set out for Moose Lake to hunt. On September 14, other hunters found gas cans, and a thermos with the name of Garson on it. These hunters reported their findings to police.  A search was initiated and police found a boat submerged upright on the bottom of the lake. The depth of the lake around the boat was only 8 to 10 feet deep. It appeared to Police that the men encountered extremely rough water while crossing Moose Lake. The motors were both found to be in forward gear. There was no floatation gear in the boat and it was heavily loaded with camping and hunting equipment. All of the bodies were recovered with the exception of M. Garson. It is presumed Mr. Garson drowned.

Case reference: 2014005182.CaseDesc: On August 1, 2007, at approximately 9:00 am, Richard Anthony Greyeyes was last seen at his residence in Calgary, Alberta.

Scar: Left Hand, On knuckles caused by curling iron

Case reference: 2014006256.CaseDesc: Christopher Maier resides in Saskatoon and came to Regina to visit family and friends in December 1994. It was assumed that Mr. Maier went back to Saskatoon, however, this information was not confirmed. Mr. Maier has not been seen since and was reported missing to the Regina Police Service on September 18, 2013.

Pierce: Ears, He had one piercing in his right ear.
Scar: Forehead, The scar was L shaped. No actual size of the scar is available.

Case reference: 2014003376.CaseDesc: Paula Wade was last seen leaving a hospital in St. Catharines, Ontario on November 25th, 1979. The next day, her abandoned vehicle was located in a parking lot in Niagara Falls, Ontario. At the time of her disappearance, Paula was despondent

Coat: Dark Blue, Orange, Ankle length navy coat with orange hood
Jewelry: Gold, Gold, Ring, With red birth stone
Scar: Abdomen, Large scar up to breasts

Case reference: 2009002699.CaseDesc: Norman Welsh was on holidays with his mother and an incident occurred on July 18, 1976, which subsequently led him to the hospital. While in the hospital he was described as bitter and un-cooperative wanting to return home in St Catharines. While being escorted to the North Bay Pyschiatric Hospital (now Northeast Mental Health Centre), he ran off into the wooded area.

Teeth: Stained, Has a 2 tooth partial plate and is missing his front upper left tooth, teeth slightly stained
Scar: Head, Under the hair, due to an operation at the age of 16

Case reference: 2005069040.CaseDesc: Yaseen is believed to be with his mother, Marina Zlonikova. They may be in the Ukraine.

Case reference: 2013000048.CaseDesc: On May 26, 2002, Mendes Joseph was seen for the last time at his apartment located in the Montréal-Nord district of Montreal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014003393.CaseDesc: James Siwy's last confirmed contact with his family was in 1982 in the Drumheller, Alberta area.  Shortly after that, he left Alberta for Ontario with some friends.  They were traveling in Mr. Siwy's 1975 white Dodge 4 door Monaco that had a burgundy roof.  His family never heard from him again.  In 1984 Mr. Siwy's Monaco was found abandoned in Ontario and there were unconfirmed reports that he may have been hitchhiking in northern Ontario.  Mr. Siwy was reported missing by his family in 1994 when they tried to notify him of the death of a family member.

Hair: Brown, Wavy, Long, parted in the middle

Case reference: 2014005033.CaseDesc: On April 28, 2000, at approximately 9:45 a.m., Kim Mezo was seen for the last time as she left the Branson Hospital in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 1996000260.CaseDesc: On March 17, 1995, Jay Boyle, Michael Cummings, Daniel Higgins, Jamie Lefebvre, Robert Rumbolt, and Chad Smith were seen for the last time walking towards the East Shore Marina in Pickering, Ontario. It is believed that the six young men boarded a boat that subsequently capsized.

Shoes: Red, Sneakers, Sneakers made of suede
Scar: Ears, Piercing scar on left ear

Hat: Black, Baseball hat-" Detroit Red Wings"

Shoes: Canvas, Black, White, Running shoes, brand "Adidas"

Case reference: 2019053661.CaseDesc:
On July 2, 1988, an unidentified man was found in the parking lot of the Value Village
on East Hastings Street in Vancouver, British Columbia. The man had suffered from a
heart attack, and the results of his autopsy showed evidence of previous heart damage and a case of mild chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).

Case reference: 2014003250.CaseDesc: On November 1, 1974, four people left the Whitedog Indian Reserve, Ontario in a 14' Lund boat and were heading for Pointe du Bois, Manitoba. Their intention was to go to Pointe du Bois to pick up supplies and then return to Whitedog. On November 5, 1974, these individuals were reported missing as they had never returned to Whitedog.  It is believed that the boat overturned and everyone drowned. Two bodies were recovered, and the cause of death was determined to be drowning. Searches were conducted by boat and by air but the bodies of Paul Scott and Richard Petawanahqueb were never recovered.  Mr. Scott and Mr. Petawanahqueb are presumed dead due to drowning. No foul play is suspected.

Case reference: 2014004535.CaseDesc: Jack Fraser was last seen on August 2, 2004 at his place of work in downtown Vancouver. His parents reported him missing as they had not seen or heard from him in over two weeks. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2008007599.CaseDesc: On September 10, 1978, Hugh Bain and three others were participating in the Oshawa Clipper Race from Oshawa, Ontario to Olcott, New York and back to Oshawa. Mr. Bain took his turn to operate the 24 foot boat. A large wave hit the boat and broke over it. The movement of the boat and the wave breaking over the boat sent him over the port side into Lake Ontario.  Mr. Bain has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014001111.CaseDesc: On February 7th, 1994, the remains of an adult male (25-50 years old), 5'10-6'0 tall, with a thin build, were located by land surveying students in a wooded area near the village of Anmore. The investigation determined the cause of death to be a self-inflicted gunshot wound. A black guitar case was found near the remains. He went missing sometime after May 1992.

Belt: Black, Blue, Fabric belt with a metal Indian Chief Belt buckle inscribed "HARA"
Jacket: Cotton, Blue, Blue with Green Gold piping sleeved Windbreaker Jacket
Pants: Nylon, Blue, Maroon, Sweat pants with zipper on cuffs
Shirt: Cotton, Grey, Black, Long Sleeved Sweatshirt

Case reference: 2014001875.CaseDesc: On May 25th, 1987 at approximately 9:00 a.m., Rene Parr left his home in Trois-Rivieres, Quebec, where he was living with his sister for the previous 6 months. He was in the process of a divorce and he was scheduled to attend the courthouse the next day. Rene has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014004626.CaseDesc: In March of 1975, “Rocky” FIDDLER, 14 years old, was reported missing by his family when he failed to return home.  It was learned, as a result of the investigation, that he was last seen in July of 1975 at a Powwow at Thunderchild First Nation, Saskatchewan, which is approximately 1.5 hours from Meadow Lake, Saskatchewan.  Investigation and searches have failed to locate him.

Case reference: 2014005011.CaseDesc: On July 28, 2005, at approximately 6:15 p.m., Senekinesh Qirma was seen for the last time at the Eaton Centre in Toronto, Ontario. Senekinesh was in Canada on a visitor’s visa.

Case reference: 2021022385.CaseDesc: On May 28, 2021, Kienan Tran was reported missing from his residence in West St. Paul, Manitoba. In May, a representative from property management entered Kienan’s residence and noticed that it was vacant. Additional details revealed that Kienan was engaged in a high-risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2013000141.CaseDesc: Brandyn Dirienzo was last seen on the evening of October 4, 2006, entering an apartment building in Chilliwack, B.C. Brandyn was living a high risk lifestyle and foul play is heavily suspected. The police investigation into the disappearance of Brandyn is focussed on identifying those who have directly caused Brandyn's disappearance and/or death.  Investigators are looking for any information from anyone who has knowledge on the whereabouts of Brandyn. Brandyn is the father of two young children and his family is deeply affected by his disappearance.

Teeth: Crooked, Current photos seem to indicate a possible broken, upper right, front tooth
Jacket: Cotton, Black, Hooded Sweatshirt with "G-Unit" logo

Case reference: 2014004162.CaseDesc: On October 16, 1987, Charles Eddy was seen for the last time when he left his residence in Moncton, New Brunswick, where he lived with his brother. Charles suffered from partial schizophrenia, was known to be heavy smoker and carry large sums of money.

Case reference: 2016043636.CaseDesc: On June 11, 1976, the body of a woman was discovered in a backyard in the Parkdale area of Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2012020016.CaseDesc: Rhody Lake disappeared on Sunday, November 27, 2005.  She was last seen going for a walk in Sechelt's Porpoise Bay Provincial Park located in Sechelt, B.C.

Hat: Red, Orange, Toque - might be beige

Case reference: 2014001361.CaseDesc: On June 13, 2000, Emmanuel Emond was reported missing in Clair, New Brunswick. Emmanuel was last seen by his family on November 28, 1996. Emmanuel is believed to have gone to Mexico at a certain point.

Scar: Cheek, Scar between nose and mouth
Tattoo: Left Hand, X on top of left hand

Case reference: 2018041855.CaseDesc: On December 8, 1992, Grayce Baxter was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. She was a known transgendered sex trade worker. She had a transaction with Patrick Johnson who subsequently confessed to her homicide. Grayce’s remains were never recovered.

Coat: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Fur, Full length coat

Case reference: 2014005890.CaseDesc: On February 15, 2012, Marie Antoinette Carlson was seen for the last time in Edmonton, Alberta. Marie has been known to travel to Calgary, Alberta and Montreal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2018015227.CaseDesc: On March 22, 2018, at approximately 1:00pm, Maria Ruiz Zein was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Maria boarded a flight to go to Colombia, but has not returned to Canada.

Case reference: 2012020125.CaseDesc: Serge Crevier was last seen on July 17, 2006, around 1:30 pm at his residence in Gatineau. The car that he was using, a grey Oldsmobile Alero 2002, was found on September 10, 2006 in Thorne, in the Outaouais region.

Case reference: 2014002404.CaseDesc: On June 11, 1988, Andrew Flett was walking with others to the cutline. Mr. Flett  did not show up at the site and crew members thought he had returned to camp. Mr. Flett  was reported missing three days later to RCMP, and an extensive search was conducted. Mr. Flett  has not been located and his whereabouts are unknown.

Shirt: Red, Black, plaid and button up

Case reference: 2014004798.CaseDesc: On the 25th of October, 1954, Tersilla Bonthoux, 79 years old, was last seen walking from Duck Lake towards the farm homestead where she used to reside, approximately 13 km away. Ms. Bonthoux was reported missing and extensive searches of the area failed to locate any trace of her.

Case reference: 2014005249.CaseDesc: Peter Cory Butler was reported missing by family on March 24, 2008. He was last seen in downtown Whitecourt, AB on March 15, 2008.

Case reference: 2017013576.CaseDesc: On December 6, 2016, Hellen Ermias and her daughter, Lina Tedros, were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. All of their personal belongings were left behind in their apartment.

Case reference: 2019009625.CaseDesc: On August 12, 2018, Nikhil Arun was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002293.CaseDesc: Gilles Hudon left the town of La Sarre, Quebec on August 20, 1980, in his aunt's car. On September 13, 1980, the car was found on a logging road near Camp 46 of the Abitibi Price logging camp in the Cochrane area of Ontario.

Case reference: 2014006557.CaseDesc: Alvin Berg, 35 years old, was originally from the Pierceland District, SK. He was working as a farm labourer in the Spinney Hill district near Maymont, SK. Mr. Berg was last seen when he left this farm in October of 1940, after which he had no further contact with his family.

Case reference: 2014002458.CaseDesc: On September 4, 1986, Rozebeh Kiani was seen for the last time in the Shaughnessy Village district of Montreal, Quebec. Rozebeh left all his personal belongings behind in his apartment and it is possible he may have travelled to Vancouver, British Columbia. Mr. Kiani speaks very little French or English.

Case reference: 2005002199.CaseDesc: On April 19, 1980, a Caucasian male was found at a campsite (Lot 19, Con 8, Peck Township) on Hardwood Lookout Trail in Algonquin Park. The death is estimated to have occurred between July 1, 1971 and Spring 1978.

Hair: Blonde, Long, Possibly in a ponytail
Belt: 36 inch, wear shown at 32 inch hole
Other: A folding camp stove; and an aluminum camper's pot with a lid
A black down-filled sleeping bag with a nylon outer shell
Wallet: Black, with 8 cent stamp issues between July 1, 1971 and September 1, 1976

Case reference: 2020011478.CaseDesc: On November 15, 1988, Mary McCarthy was seen for the last time at her apartment in Toronto, Ontario. Mary’s vehicle was later found on November 17, 1988 at the bus depot in Niagara Falls, Ontario. Mary was a chartered accountant working for CSA Management Ltd. at the time of her disappearance.

Case reference: 2018035793.CaseDesc: On June 25, 2018, Desmond Fischer was seen for the last time as he left his residence to go for a walk in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan. Desmond is known for following a very strict routine, and his disappearance is out of character.

Case reference: 2014006086.CaseDesc: Martin Geoffrion was last seen on April 26, 2013 in Montreal. He left his home around 4:00 pm in a Mercedes vehicle. On April 30, 2013, the Mercedes was located in a cul-de-sac in St-Roch de l'Achigan. According to his relatives, Mr. Geoffrion was not suicidal. He loved fishing and playing golf.

Case reference: 2006000199.CaseDesc: October 26, 1986, an unidentified man was found under the ramp to the Gardiner Expressway and Spadina Avenue behind 252 Queens Quay West, in Toronto, Ontario. He was well-nourished, and was found not wearing any clothing.

Hair: Grey, White, Short, Male pattern baldness, 4mm facial stubble
Mark: Left Elbow, Small mole on the side of his left elbow

Case reference: 2013000047.CaseDesc: On August 11, 2000, Gianfranco Ferrara was for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. He had an appointment in the east end of Montreal but he never showed up.

Case reference: 2012020055.CaseDesc:
The body of an Asian male was discovered by cleaning staff at the Northbrook Inn in Grand Rapids, Manitoba.  The individual had checked in at 15:30h after arriving on the bus from Winnipeg.  At 18:00h cleaning staff entered the room to find the occupant deceased in a chair.
It was learned that the subject checked into the hotel under the name "CHERON, Deoung".  A small black bag containing herbal medication was located in the room, which after translation from Korean revealed the prescription was issued to "PARK, Seng Dae"(variation of spelling PARK, Sang Dae).  It should be noted that the bus ticket-stub was located with the deceased identified "DUNG" as the individual who purchased the ticket.
Numerous checks were made with variety of agencies in an attempt to determine the man's identity.  It is believed he may be of Korean or Chinese decent.

Case reference: 2018063467.CaseDesc: On December 12, 1995, at approximately 2:00 am, Ahmad Kharashfeh was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Jacket: Leather, Black, Short jacket with 2 red lines in the front

Case reference: 2010003899.CaseDesc: Pierre Mercon, age 21, a lifelong resident of Vaughan, Ontario, was last seen at approximately 2:00 A.M. on November 1st, 1996. He was observed leaving the "Original Six" Sports Bar, located on Oxford Street in the Town of Richmond Hill, where he had attended a Halloween Party and was last seen wearing a costume of Army fatigues, work boots, a green wool hat and a long black wig. Foul play is suspected in his disappearance.

Tattoo: Right Shoulder, Back of right shoulder, tattoo of Uruguay

Case reference: 2018054233.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2018, Xinye Wang was last seen in China. Xinye was scheduled to return to Canada but has not been heard from or seen since.
